page.title: 03HOME FARM - COWS
page.content: The dairy herd is based at Home Farm, Unthank, and consists of 120 Friesian and 60 Ayrshire cows. They are housed over the winter in a cubicle loose housing system and fed on silage, home produced cereals and purchased concentrates. Over the summer they graze the adjoining pastures on a set stocking system. Milking is done through a 16 stall, 16 unit herringbone low line parlour with A.C.R.s, and the milk is stored in a 3,800 litres bulk tank. Average yield is 5400 litres at 4.10% butterfat and 3.3% protein. Some cows are bred pure for replacements, the rest are crossed to beef bulls and sold at 2 weeks. 200 acres of the farm are devoted to dairy cows, with a further 60 acres of Park for replacement young stock.
